revised_title: Morris William Travers: A Pioneer in the Discovery of Rare Gases
tldr: Morris William Travers was a prominent chemist who played a significant role in the discovery of rare gases such as argon, krypton, and xenon. Travers worked closely with Sir William Ramsay, and their research led to the expansion of the Periodic Table and the understanding of the properties of these rare gases. Travers's contributions to the field of chemistry are still celebrated today.
